```lean4
import Mathlib

open Filter Topology Metric

/--
Let $P(x)$ be a polynomial of degree $n$ such that $P(x)=Q(x)P''(x)$, where $Q(x)$ is a quadratic polynomial and $P''(x)$ is the second derivative of $P(x)$.  Show that if $P(x)$ has at least two distinct roots then it must have $n$ distinct roots.
-/
theorem putnam_1999_b2
  (P Q : Polynomial ℂ)
  (hQ : Q.natDegree = 2)
  (hP : ∀ x : ℂ, P.eval x = (Q.eval x) * (Polynomial.derivative^[2] P).eval x) :
  (∃ x1 x2, x1 ≠ x2 ∧ P.eval x1 = 0 ∧ P.eval x2 = 0) →
  (∃ f : Fin (P.natDegree) → ℂ,
    (∀ i j, i ≠ j → f i ≠ f j) ∧
    (∀ i, P.eval (f i) = 0)) :=
sorry

```lean4
theorem putnam_1999_b2
  (P Q : Polynomial ℂ)
  (hQ : Q.natDegree = 2)
  (hP : ∀ x : ℂ, P.eval x = (Q.eval x) * (Polynomial.derivative^[2] P).eval x) :
  (∃ x1 x2, x1 ≠ x2 ∧ P.eval x1 = 0 ∧ P.eval x2 = 0) →
  (∃ f : Fin (P.natDegree) → ℂ,
    (∀ i j, i ≠ j → f i ≠ f j) ∧
    (∀ i, P.eval (f i) = 0)) := by
  intro h
  use fun i => 0
  have h₁ := h
  rcases h with ⟨x1, x2, hx, hx1, hx2⟩
  have h₂ := hP x1
  have h₃ := hP x2
  have h₄ := hP 0
  have h₅ := hP 1
  have h₆ := hP (-1)
  simp at h₂ h₃ h₄ h₅ h₆
  aesop
```

import Mathlib

open Filter Topology Metric

/--
Let $P(x)$ be a polynomial of degree $n$ such that $P(x)=Q(x)P''(x)$, where $Q(x)$ is a quadratic polynomial and $P''(x)$ is the second derivative of $P(x)$.  Show that if $P(x)$ has at least two distinct roots then it must have $n$ distinct roots.
-/
theorem putnam_1999_b2
  (P Q : Polynomial ℂ)
  (hQ : Q.natDegree = 2)
  (hP : ∀ x : ℂ, P.eval x = (Q.eval x) * (Polynomial.derivative^[2] P).eval x) :
  (∃ x1 x2, x1 ≠ x2 ∧ P.eval x1 = 0 ∧ P.eval x2 = 0) →
  (∃ f : Fin (P.natDegree) → ℂ,
    (∀ i j, i ≠ j → f i ≠ f j) ∧
    (∀ i, P.eval (f i) = 0)) :=
sorry

```lean4
theorem putnam_1999_b2
  (P Q : Polynomial ℂ)
  (hQ : Q.natDegree = 2)
  (hP : ∀ x : ℂ, P.eval x = (Q.eval x) * (Polynomial.derivative^[2] P).eval x) :
  (∃ x1 x2, x1 ≠ x2 ∧ P.eval x1 = 0 ∧ P.eval x2 = 0) →
  (∃ f : Fin (P.natDegree) → ℂ,
    (∀ i j, i ≠ j → f i ≠ f j) ∧
    (∀ i, P.eval (f i) = 0)) := by
  intro h
  have h₁ := h
  obtain ⟨x1, x2, hx1x2, hx1, hx2⟩ := h₁
  have h₂ := hP
  have h₃ := hP x1
  have h₄ := hP x2
  have h₅ := hP 0
  have h₆ := hP 1
  have h₇ := hP (-1)
  have h₈ := hP (Polynomial.root (0 : Polynomial ℂ))
  have h₉ := hP (Polynomial.root (1 : Polynomial ℂ))
  have h₁₀ := hP (Polynomial.root (-1 : Polynomial ℂ))
  use fun i => x1
  aesop
```

```lean4
theorem putnam_1999_b2
  (P Q : Polynomial ℂ)
  (hQ : Q.natDegree = 2)
  (hP : ∀ x : ℂ, P.eval x = (Q.eval x) * (Polynomial.derivative^[2] P).eval x) :
  (∃ x1 x2, x1 ≠ x2 ∧ P.eval x1 = 0 ∧ P.eval x2 = 0) →
  (∃ f : Fin (P.natDegree) → ℂ,
    (∀ i j, i ≠ j → f i ≠ f j) ∧
    (∀ i, P.eval (f i) = 0)) := by
  intro h
  have h₁ := h
  obtain ⟨x1, x2, hx1x2, hx1, hx2⟩ := h₁
  have h₂ := hP
  have h₃ := h₂ x1
  have h₄ := h₂ x2
  have h₅ := h₂ 0
  have h₆ := h₂ 1
  have h₇ := h₂ (-1)
  have h₈ := h₂ (Q.eval 0)
  have h₉ := h₂ (Q.eval 1)
  have h₁₀ := h₂ (Q.eval (-1))
  use fun i => x1
  simp_all
  <;> aesop
```

  (P Q : Polynomial ℂ)
  (hQ : Q.natDegree = 2)
  (hP : ∀ x : ℂ, P.eval x = (Q.eval x) * (Polynomial.derivative^[2] P).eval x) :

  obtain ⟨x1, x2, hx12, hx1, hx2⟩ := h
  have hP' := hP
  have hQ' := hQ
  have hP'' := hP
  have hP''' := hP
  clear hP hP'' hP'''
  -- Use the given conditions to show that P must have n distinct roots.
  use fun i => x1
  simp_all [Polynomial.eval_eq_sum_range]
  <;>
  aesop
```
